isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - DIAGNOSTICS - GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING

svcproc.title: GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: If during the power up Speedo/Tach self test, one or more of the electronic gauges did not go through the full sweep and did not go to the 6 o'clock position:

step1.para: Switch the gauge with one of the other electronic gauges that went through the full sweep. Rerun the power up test.

step2.para: Oil Pressure, Water Temp, Voltmeter or Fuel Gauge - If the suspect gauge went through the full sweep in a different gauge location, and the known good gauge in the suspect location did not make a full sweep, go to step C.

If the speedometer or tachometer are switched and the suspect gauge went through the full sweep in the other location, and the known good gauge in the suspect location did not make a full sweep, replace the Speedo/Tach module.
If the suspect gauge did not go through a full sweep in a different location and the known good gauge moved to the suspect location, went through a full sweep, replace the suspect gauge.

Oil Pressure, Water Temp, Voltmeter, Fuel - If the known good gauge did not go through a full sweep in the suspect gauge location, refer to TROUBLESHOOTINGand troubleshoot the gauge circuits between the Speedo/Tach module and the suspect gauge cluster pins. If the gauge circuits to the cluster pins check good, replace the Speedo/Tach module.
